com.codename1.webrtc

Interface RTCPromise<T>


  • public interface RTCPromise<T>

    The Promise object represents the eventual completion (or failure) of an asynchronous operation, and its resulting value.

    See Also:
    https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T get()
      Waits for the promise to resolve and retrieves the value, or throws an exception if the promise failed to resolve.
      RTCPromise<T> onCatch(SuccessCallback<Throwable> onRejected)
      Appends a rejection handler callback to the promise, and returns a new promise resolving to the return value of the callback if it is called, or to its original fulfillment value if the promise is instead fulfilled.
      RTCPromise<T> onFinally(SuccessCallback onFinally)
      Appends a handler to the promise, and returns a new promise that is resolved when the original promise is resolved.
      RTCPromise<T> then(SuccessCallback<T> onFulfilled)
      Appends fulfillment and rejection handlers to the promise, and returns a new promise resolving to the return value of the called handler, or to its original settled value if the promise was not handled (i.e.
      RTCPromise<T> then(SuccessCallback<T> onFulfilled, SuccessCallback<Throwable> onRejected)
      Appends fulfillment and rejection handlers to the promise, and returns a new promise resolving to the return value of the called handler, or to its original settled value if the promise was not handled (i.e.

    • Method Detail

      • then

        RTCPromise<T> then(SuccessCallback<T> onFulfilled)

        Appends fulfillment and rejection handlers to the promise, and returns a new promise resolving to the return value of the called handler, or to its original settled value if the promise was not handled (i.e. if the relevant handler onFulfilled or onRejected is not a function).

        Parameters:
        onFulfilled -
        Returns:

      • then

        RTCPromise<T> then(SuccessCallback<T> onFulfilled,
                   SuccessCallback<Throwable> onRejected)

        Appends fulfillment and rejection handlers to the promise, and returns a new promise resolving to the return value of the called handler, or to its original settled value if the promise was not handled (i.e. if the relevant handler onFulfilled or onRejected is not a function).

        Parameters:
        onFulfilled -
        onRejected -
        Returns:

      • onCatch

        RTCPromise<T> onCatch(SuccessCallback<Throwable> onRejected)

        Appends a rejection handler callback to the promise, and returns a new promise resolving to the return value of the callback if it is called, or to its original fulfillment value if the promise is instead fulfilled.

        Parameters:
        onRejected -
        Returns:

      • onFinally

        RTCPromise<T> onFinally(SuccessCallback onFinally)

        Appends a handler to the promise, and returns a new promise that is resolved when the original promise is resolved. The handler is called when the promise is settled, whether fulfilled or rejected.

        Parameters:
        onFinally -
        Returns:

      • get

        T get()

        Waits for the promise to resolve and retrieves the value, or throws an exception if the promise failed to resolve.

        Note
        		 This is uses Display.invokeAndBlock(java.lang.Runnable) under the hood.
        Returns:
